page.title: SpringSaLaD Application
page.introduction: A SpringSaLaD application is designed to add spatial details to Sites and Links within a Molecule, and to define and run simulations using the Langevin Solver.
page.appearance:
When using SpringSaLaD Applications, it is important to be aware that:
The Langevin solver can be used with any Rule-based model that obeys the limitations described below.
The Langevin solver performs a stochastic simulation, so simulation results will vary by run.
A very strict geometry is required
The complexity of calculations makes it practical only for a small number of particles
Using a Network-Free application has the following limitations:
The model must have exactly 3 structures, 2 compartments named "Intracellular" and "Extracellular" separated by a "Membrane"
All the sites require several attribute, like diameter and relative position to one another.
The reaction rules are strictly categorized and must obey several syntax restrictions.
